respStmt.name: miscelaneous Mixtepec-Mixtec speaker from San Lucas Mixtepec

publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: En este cuento se narran los preparativos y el viaje de tres tortugas que iban a asistir a una boda.

sourceDesc.bibl:
Ntinuni ntintsitsa Beckmann, Gisela(consultant); Nieves, María M.(consultant). 2008. (2nd ed.). Tlalpan, D.F., México:Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C.
narrator miscelaneous Mixtepec-Mixtec speaker from San Lucas Mixtepec Obtained from:

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;

normalization.ab: 2018-04-04Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml. Instances of "ña" still remain to be changed pending consultation with Mille (or other person working on orthography).

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='en'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='es'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent where a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: One day someone invited all three turtles to a wedding party.
Un día alguien invitó todos las tres torgugas a una fiesta de boda.
Then the turtles arrived and they were very happy, then they said:
Y las tortugas llegaron y estaban muy felizes, y pues dijeron:
If we go to the party, we have to buy ourselves lipstick, perfume and a necklace
Se vamos a la fiesta, tenemos que comprarnos pintalabios, un perfume y un collar.
you buy our lipstick and you buy a perfume to put on our clothes and I will buy three necklaces to wear on our necks.
tú compra nuestro pintalabios y tú compra un perfume para poner en nuestras ropas, y yo compro tres collares para llevar en los cuellos.
The day of the party arrived and they showered, they changed clothes, put on lipstick, sprayed perfume and put on thier necklaces.
Llegó el día de la fiesta, se ducharon, se cambiaron las ropas, se pusieron pintalabios, rociaron perfume y llevaron sus collares.
Then when they were done, they looked for a way to walk(?).... carrying the gift.
cuando terminaron, buscaron un camino a ir (?)....cargando el regalo.
And then they arrived and began climbing up the stairs and walking little by little because in order to not fall down.
Y llegaron y empezaron a escalar las escaleras caminando poco a poco para que no se caigan.
There were seven stairs to do before they would reach the end.
Habían siete escalones a hacer antes que lleguen al fin.
When they took another step it slipped and fell all the way to the bottom of the stairs.
Cuando dió un otro paso, resbaló y se cayó todo el camino al fondo de las escaleras.
all the way down the stairs
todo el camino al fondo de las escaleras
When they were sitting on the ground they heard a sound from the door:
Cuando se sentaban por el piso oyeron un sonido de la puerta:
It's bad we were in a hurry because we got hurt falling down.
Es malo que teníamos prisa porque nos herimos cayendo.
The next time they invite us back, we'll go and we should walk little by little.
La proxima vez que nos invitan de nuevo, vamos a ir y deberíamos caminar poco a poco.
